entries.name: Overview
entries: 你的角色可能在探索下水道时不小心跌入了水蓄池，或者通过从{@area Black Ivory Inn|25f|x}进入走私者通道而到达。水蓄池就在屠杀石广场的正下方，所以角色甚至可以在这里躲避刽子手。在继续阅读本节之前，你应该先查看一下那个地点。

entries.name: An Invitation from the Duchess
entries: 在探索河流、下水道或其他水域时，角色们遇到了一个好奇的群体，其中有12个{@creature Delerium Dreg|DoDk|aquatic delerium dregs}和2个{@creature Chuul||chuuls}，他们并不表现出敌意。两个人小心翼翼地走上前来，自我介绍为Blip-Bloop和Slurpy。他们恳求角色们帮助他们找到一份合适的礼物带回给他们的女主人，他们称她为"公爵夫人"。如果被询问，他们可以传达以下信息：

items: "我们的公爵夫人(`Duchess`)一定会对您表示极大的款待！如果您给她带来一份礼物或者为她提供服务，她一定会慷慨回报您，我敢肯定！您想要什么呢？知识！魔法！健康！我们的公爵夫人(`Duchess`)既强大又仁慈，我敢肯定！"
"她会喜欢一个魔法小玩意，或者一个伟大的水晶，当然！我肯定的！"
“公爵夫人是深水之主，她统治着所有流淌在她领地下方的一切！我确信！她庇护并保护我们，而我们则是她忠诚的臣仆，我确信！”
"她居住在一个收集天空水的巨大水池附近。水面上有一台可怕的机器，但我们知道一条通过水路的隐藏通道！我敢肯定！"

entries: 如果角色在第一次会面时拒绝或发动攻击，他们可能会在将来的城市冒险中再次遇到这个团体（或类似的团体）。不要强迫玩家角色接受这个线索：这是他们应该自发调查的事情！

entries.name: Alternate Hooks
entries: 很容易错过这个冒险地点，但由于它包含一个重要的{@i Seal of Drakkenheim}，你可能需要进行故障排除。如果你的玩家们没有上钩，考虑以下方法：

items: 其中一位派系领袖要求角色调查以下谣言："据说许多被杀的冒险者和派系特工的尸体安息在屠杀石广场下面的水槽中。谁知道那里失落了多少魔法物品呢？"
与水生残渣的相遇留下了一个线索，与角色的个人任务相关，表明水生残渣拥有一个失落的魔法物品或失踪的人物（现在已经变成水生残渣之一，甚至是公爵夫人的侍从）。

entries.name: Interactions
entries: 公爵夫人是一个超自然的可怕存在，控制着许多变异的水生狂乱淤泥，在其控制下，利用它们收集狂乱并诱使毫无戒心的探险者前往其巢穴受污染。

entries.name: The Duchess
entries: 公爵夫人是一个{@creature aboleth}，其起源深不可测。无论是被Haze中不稳定的裂缝带到这里，还是某种变异起源的结果，都无人能说得准。它利用自己的知识、心灵感应和读心能力，提出诱人的虚假提议，吸引角色内心最深的欲望，操纵他们接受污染，从而成为它的奴隶。

items.name: Personality Trait
items.entry: 我像一个仁慈的女家长统治我的臣民，热情地邀请客人来到我的家中，让他们永远为我效劳。

items.name: Ideal
items.entry: 无法阻止Haze的命运，所有人都将被污染和腐化，所有人都将沐浴在遥远星辰的神秘拥抱中。

items.name: Bond
items.entry: 我听到了在德拉肯城堡（Castle Drakken）中的合并者（the Amalgamation）的号角。很快它将打开一个维度裂缝。我必须寻找仆人和魔法，这样我才能夺取它。

items.name: Flaw
items.entry: 当凡人不敬畏和崇敬我时，我会变得愤怒和不耐烦。

entries: 公爵夫人深深地与“Haze”（迷雾）的魔法相契合。尽管不知道陨石的起源，公爵夫人意识到“Haze”最终将会笼罩整个世界，并能感知到德拉肯城堡内的维度裂缝（见{@area chapter 9|5ff|x}）。她正在积累狂乱、魔法物品和被污染的奴仆，希望有朝一日夺取裂缝并统治地表。她模糊地明白{@i Seals of Drakkenheim}在这方面可能会有用，因此也想获取那些物品。

entries.name: Duchess' Attendants
entries: 这三个可怜虫是公爵夫人宠爱的奴隶。被称为红衣主教、总管和大臣，他们每个人都是被污染转化的前人类。他们使用 {@creature sea hag} 的游戏统计数据，但生物类型改为畸变。这些侍从利用他们的力量，化身为穿着流动蓝袍的人类，诱使并欺骗访客，但他们的变异比水生狂乱残余更可怕，他们视之为自己的服从同类。他们原始的记忆和个性几乎被疯狂抹除，现在忠实地为公爵夫人的奇怪议程服务。他们照料着公爵夫人的纪念碑在 {@area Bathhouse Ruins|42b|x}。大臣实际上是德拉肯海姆的皇家大臣巴尔林·巴尔斯的转化形态，仍然穿着 {@item Chancellor's Crest|DoDk}。

items.name: Personality Trait
items.entry: 我们是公爵夫人的侍从。来看看我们的习俗，参与我们奇怪的方式，一切都会揭晓。水中隐藏着巨大的秘密；深饮它的智慧。

items.name: Ideal
items.entry: 我们的祝福奉献帮助公爵夫人在她开启道路和大门的探索中。

items.name: Bond
items.entry: 我们逃离了城堡，但没有走得更远。公爵夫人( the Duchess)救了我们。

items.name: Flaw
items.entry: 我们不记得我们曾经是谁，但公爵夫人告诉我们，我们必须做好准备，有朝一日从水中崛起，再次踏上陆地。

entries.name: Area Details
entries: 这些地区的水被污染了。在游泳或浸泡在污染水中结束他们的回合的角色必须成功通过一次 DC 10 的体质豁免检定，否则会获得一个 {@adventure level of contamination|DoDk|12}。饮用污染水的角色会获得一个 {@adventure level of contamination|DoDk|12}。

entries.name: [1] Underground Cistern
entries: 这个地下水库是一个高八十英尺的圆柱体，顶部是一个由防水混凝土和石板制成的圆顶。顶部有一个直径五英尺的开口，通向屠石广场的接水喷泉。一个狭窄的五英尺宽的石头人行道建在离圆柱体底部二十英尺高的地方，环绕着一个直径三十英尺的水池。

entries.name: [1a] Basin
entries: 下方的水库几乎满了，水位仅比人行道边缘低两英尺。 水池底部堆满了数十具浸泡在水中的尸体，他们是头巾灯笼会(Hooded Lanterns)、女王的士兵(Queen's Men)和与刽子手(Executioner)为敌的对手冒险者的尸体；他们的尸体被狂暴的构造物扔到这里。 尽管大多数普通装备都已经毁坏，角色可以找到一个装有{@dice 2d6} {@adventure delerium fragments|DoDk|13|Delerium}的背包，以及一个装有价值500金币的硬币、宝石和其他贵重物品的袋子。 如果你愿意，你可以在这里放置{@dice 1d4}个普通魔法物品或一个非凡魔法物品。

items: 两名{@creature Chuul||chuuls}和12名{@creature Delerium Dreg|DoDk|aquatic delerium dregs}在宝藏中挑选。如果角色自己找到了水池，那么这些人就是{@area Adventure Hooks|4b7|x}部分描述的团队。

entries.name: [1b] Aqueduct Passage
entries: 水从盆地被虹吸到这条地下水渠中；十英尺直径开口的中心大致与人行道对齐。一个有栅栏的排水格可以通过进行一次 DC 15 力量检定来移除。格子后面是一个形如桶的通道，淹没到大腿。在前行两百英尺后，天花板上出现了一个裂缝，通向浴室废墟 (Bathhouse Ruins)。

entries.name: [1c] Sewer Canal
entries: 这些滑溜的台阶通往这个宽阔楼梯的下方，通往整个下水道系统。 一个破旧的大门曾经将其关闭。 这些水道通向何方，就由你决定。

entries.name: [1d] Slaughterstone Stair
entries: 这条狭窄的螺旋楼梯向上延伸六十英尺至地面，最终到达一个小平台，上面有一把短梯子通往一个三英尺宽的沉重的锻铁排水井盖。从下方打开盖子需要一个动作和一个DC 15的力量检定。它打开后通往{@area Slaughterstone Square|4ba|x}。

entries.name: [1e] Smuggler's Tunnel
entries: 这条宽阔的螺旋楼梯向上升高二十英尺，然后在一个小平台结束，通向一个大约四英尺宽、八英尺高的粗糙拱形隧道。这条通道蜿蜒曲折一段距离，最终连接到黑象客栈（见{@area Outer City Ruins|25f|x}）的地下室。

这个部分埋藏的长方形房间看起来像是古代建造的浴室。一条有柱子的通道环绕着一个中央池塘，池塘里有一个精美的圆形喷泉，上面装饰着沐浴在一个被遗忘的神周围的仙女雕像。墙壁上的浮雕雕刻描绘了原始场景，有风暴、沉船和充满复仇心的水怪。池塘的一端是一个半圆形的凹室，那里有一块像人一样高的巨大癫狂水晶从地板上伸出。它被一团厚厚的搏动的静脉和滴水的奇怪黑色结节所包围，结节上还镶嵌着棱彩色。发光的石头照亮了整个房间。池塘的对面是一个宽敞的拱形水道，水从那里流入房间。空气又冷又潮湿，流水的声音在房间里回荡。头顶上的拱形天花板已经龟裂并开始下陷。

items: 这座雕像描绘了海洋和风暴之神——古老的神祇Nodens。
这里有三位{@creature Sea Hag||sea hags}- 大臣、总管和主教。他们可能会与10（{@dice 3d6}）{@creature Delerium Dreg|DoDk|aquatic delerium dregs}和可能还有一个{@creature chuul}一起出现。
他们起初并不敌对，而是邀请角色喝下他们用错觉尘混合的污染水，接触错觉晶石，然后与公爵夫人进行心灵感应交流。这个过程无疑会让角色濒临发生怪物化的转变。

{@b {@i Delerium}.} 这是一个{@adventure massive delerium geode cluster|DoDk|13|Delerium}。要将其移除异常困难，但周围生长着{@dice 2d6} {@adventure delerium shards|DoDk|13|Delerium}，这些更容易收割。公爵夫人的侍从们在与公爵夫人进行心灵感应交流时会触摸这块晶石，并称其为“公爵夫人的纪念碑”（the Monument of the Duchess）。
{@b {@i Treasure}.} 大臣将 {@item Chancellor's Crest|DoDk} 醒目地别在他们的长袍上。 这件宝贵的物品是其中之一 {@i Seals of Drakkenheim}。 在这里保存的瓮、碗和袋中，有 {@dice 1d4} 不寻常的 {@item Spell Scroll||spell scrolls} 或药水。

entries: 这个房间是一座曾经辉煌的圆形浴池的废墟。

items: 一个{@creature hydra}居住在这里，受公爵夫人的控制，作为个人守护者。它很少离开这个房间，除非是为了吞食无价值的手下。

entries: 这个巨大的洞穴被充斥着奥卡特林光，数百颗小狂热水晶镶嵌在洞穴墙壁上，将其照亮。水从悬挂钟乳石之间的裂缝中流出，填满了大型地下湖泊，湖水深邃，闪烁着狂热的光芒。空气中充满了湿气，黏液状的粘液冲上岸边，厚厚的污垢团附着在石头上。最微小的声音在洞穴中回荡，带着一种怪异的混响。

items: 地下湖开始很浅，但很快就达到了三十英尺的深度。钟乳石覆盖的洞穴天花板仅离水面十五英尺远。
这是{@creature Aboleth||Duchess}的巢穴。这个生物隐藏在黑暗的水下。如果它察觉到敌对入侵者，它会试图诱使它们靠近岸边，这样它就可以轻松地将它们拖入被污染的水中。
如果遭受攻击，公爵夫人会向手下发出心灵呼唤，4 {@creature merrow} 和 12 {@creature Delerium Dreg|DoDk|aquatic delerium dregs} 会在五轮后赶来帮助保护公爵夫人。

{@b {@i Delerium}.} 洞穴壁壁上布满了无数闪闪发光的狂喜之屑，但是经过数小时的挖掘，角色们可以发掘到10个({@dice 3d6}) {@adventure delerium shards|DoDk|13|Delerium} 和 {@dice 1d4} {@adventure delerium crystals|DoDk|13|Delerium}。 角色检查洞穴壁壁时可以发现狂喜水晶镶嵌在岩石中。这些碎片绝对不可能来自陨石，它们埋得太深了。
水面下是一条宽阔的地下河，连接着德兰河(Drann River)。

水面上看不到任何松散的泥土和沙堆，但对于任何潜水的人来说很明显。挖掘这个土堆需要一分钟的时间，里面藏着公爵夫人的个人财宝。它包含{@dice 1d4} {@adventure delerium crystals|DoDk|13|Delerium}，{@dice 1d6} 个防水管，每个管子里装着一颗稀有的{@item spell scroll}，{@dice 3d6} 其他宝石或价值250金币的宝物，以及一件稀有的魔法物品。

entries.name: Developments
entries: 无论角色们是否能从公爵夫人那里学到任何东西，杀死这个可怕的畸形生物都能结束一个可怕的祸害，防止其腐烂和恶化。如果不加阻止，公爵夫人可能会成为一个潜在的闯入者，干涉未来事件。或者，公爵夫人可能会决定在别处追求自己的利益，通过被污染的德兰河离开德拉肯海姆。它沿着下游流向大海，将其腐化影响传播到更广阔的世界中。

entries.name: The Chancellor's Crest
entries: 那些找回{@item Chancellor's Crest|DoDk}的角色有一个重大发现。作为失踪的{@i Seals of Drakkenheim}之一，这是进入城市的关键之一。如果披风灯笼会和女王的士兵发现角色拥有它，他们会试图与他们会面。Elias Drexel和盗贼女王都会利用这个机会招募角色加入他们的阵营。如果角色拒绝了这个提议，这些阵营会开始制定计划通过偷袭、欺骗，甚至必要时使用武力来夺取{@i Chancellor's Crest}。

entries.name: Queen's Park
entries: 休憩在城市北部的心脏地带，位于神秘塔楼和德拉肯城堡之间，女王公园（Queen's Park）是为了纪念在德拉肯海姆（Drakkenheim）统治为君主的女王们而建造的，而那些皇家配偶也在这里被纪念。随着时间的推移，更多纪念其他定义德拉肯海姆历史的知名女性的纪念碑也在这里建造了。平民和贵族都喜欢在夏日的下午漫步于女王公园，迷恋于其优雅的美丽。如今被深雾覆盖，一个人可能会在这里永远迷失。

entries.name: Overview
entries: 一次前往女王公园的探险原本是为了寻找{@item aqua expurgo|DoDk}的关键成分，但最终可能会让角色们发现一个关于皇室成员命运的令人震惊的发现。

entries.name: Gathering Eldritch Lilies
entries: 在研究奥斯卡·约伦（Oscar Yoren）的研究或听到某些谣言的角色可能会得知据说在皇后公园（Queen's Park）生长的魔法花朵具有抗污染的特性。那些进一步研究的人可以了解到以下信息：

items: 一朵奥术百合是一种生长在深雾覆盖的自然地区受污染水池中的粉紫色花朵。这些植物有一种奇怪的气味，并在十英尺内发出一种神奇的清脆声音。用{@spell detect magic}检查时，它们会显示出独特的魔法光环。一朵奥术百合价值100 gp。花瓣是强大的炼金材料，可以用作恢复法术和许多药水的组成部分。

entries.name: Interactions
entries: 当角色们探索女王公园时，他们可以了解到女王莱诺尔·冯·凯瑟尔的悲惨命运，甚至找到前皇室配偶。
当陨石坠落的那一天，在德拉肯城堡，混乱爆发了，因为工作人员和皇室家族试图逃离“薄雾”。在皇家管家的请求下，莱诺尔女王的侍从帮助她通过一条通往女王公园的秘密水路逃离了德拉肯城堡。受莱诺尔的行李队阻碍，皇家随行人员在扩散的雾气中迷失方向，并被转变成了怪物。自那时起，他们一直留在这里，被驱使着陷入疯狂，几乎没有留下任何记忆。

entries.name: Lost Lenore

entries: 这个忧郁的生物身高六英尺，拥有细长的四肢。她的粉白皮肤裂开并坚硬如石头，头发是一团厚重湿润的卷须，末端长着带着牙齿的嘴。她戴着一条翡翠项链和一件破旧的黑色晚礼服。她用披肩遮住头发，用破裂的瓷面具遮住脸。
{@creature Lenore von Kessel|DoDk}，德拉肯海姆的王后兼乌尔里希四世的妻子，已经变成了一个怪物，使用{@creature medusa}的游戏统计数据。用以下内容替换正常的{@i Petrifying Gaze}特性和动作：

items: {@b {@i Radiant Gaze}.} 当一个可以看到莱诺尔的眼睛的生物在她的30英尺内开始它的回合时，如果她不是{@condition incapacitated}并且可以看到这个生物，莱诺尔可以强迫它进行一次DC 14的体质豁免检定。生物在豁免失败时受到22({@dice 4d10})点辐射伤害，豁免成功则减半。此外，未能通过这次豁免检定的生物会获得一个{@adventure level of contamination|DoDk|12}。
除非{@quickref surprised|PHB|3|0|surprised}，生物可以在其回合开始时避开视线以免进行豁免投掷。如果生物这样做，它在下一个回合开始前都看不见莱诺尔，届时它可以再次避开视线。如果生物在此期间看向莱诺尔，它必须立即进行豁免投掷。
如果莱诺尔（Lenore）在距离她不到30英尺的明亮光线区域内看到自己在一个抛光表面上的倒影，她将变成{@condition blinded}和{@condition incapacitated}，持续{@dice 1d6}小时。
{@b {@i Tentacle Hair}.}{@i Melee Weapon Attack}: 攻击加值+5，射程5英尺，一个生物。{@i Hit}: 4 ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) 穿刺伤害加上14 ({@dice 4d6}) 僵尸伤害。目标必须成功通过DC 14的体质豁免才能获得一个{@adventure level of contamination|DoDk|12}。

entries: 被雾气转变后，莱诺尔（Lenore）成为了她以前的自己的嘲弄，并对自己的外貌感到厌恶。她模糊地记得曾在她的岩洞中寻求庇护，但不记得自己是如何逃离城堡的。

items.name: Personality Trait
items.entry: 我轻声细语地说着，永恒地陶醉在白日梦中，如狂想般地想象自己置身于一个悲剧童话故事中，同时将他人塑造成虚构角色。

items.name: Ideal
items.entry: 这个世界就像一面镜子，反射出我自己的光辉影像。

items.name: Bond
items.entry: 我痴迷于追求美丽、奢华，沉醉于各种艺术之中，尤其热爱我的花园和我的百合。它们是我唯一剩下的一切。

items.name: Flaw
items.entry: 当我看到自己的相似之处或者我失去的家人的名字时，我会勃然大怒。

entries: 任何精通{@skill History}的角色都能立刻认出莱诺尔（Lenore），尽管她已经发生了变异。在变身之前，莱诺尔非常虚荣自恋，然而对待仆人却异常地温和善良。她总是穿着华丽的礼服、帽子、化妆品和珠宝，其中包括一条镶有十一颗祖母绿的著名金项链。她只把自己的孩子当作自己的延伸，绝对鄙视她的丈夫。

entries.name: Queen's Retinue
entries: 曾经是莱诺尔（Lenore）的私人侍从的转化生物，现在每个都使用{@creature dryad}的游戏统计数据。现在被称为侍女们，它们看起来像是穿着长满苔藓的衬裙、头发像黏糊糊的草、皮肤像多瘤的树皮的凌乱而畸形的身影。

items: 就像在他们前世一样，这些不幸的可怜人侍奉、服从和保护莱诺尔，但只有他们自己的零碎记忆。
他们行事回避、胆怯、和奴性，但在履行职责时坚决果断。他们利用自己的能力误导和阻止入侵者到达皇家洞穴，同时在花园中徘徊寻找狂喜和古怪百合花，以取悦莱诺尔(`Lenore`)。
如果与她们互动，角色可以通过成功进行三次 DC 15 魅力检定来说服侍女们带领他们前往皇家洞穴，也许可以将自己描述为勇敢的骑士来帮助或编造其他寓言。否则，角色可以跟随或追赶她们返回皇家洞穴。

entries: 另外，花园中漫步的许多{@creature Haze Wight|DoDk|haze wights}都是女王个人护卫的不死残魂，仍然佩戴着凯瑟尔伯爵家族的纹章和侍从服饰。

女王公园(Queen's Park)的迷宫般的小径蜿蜒穿过巴洛克风格的花坛，呈几何布局，沿着蜿蜒曲折的小道穿过森林树丛，跨过装饰华丽的桥梁，横跨人工溪流和池塘。草坪和广场点缀着凯旋门、大理石喷泉、雕塑花园和树篱迷宫，但公园已经长满了杂草，荒凉而被厚厚的闪闪发光的雾气覆盖。顽强的藤蔓像寄生虫一样紧贴在雕像上，奇异色彩的花朵在花园中绽放。一种强烈的花粉悬浮在空气中 - 一种介于麝香和甜美香水之间的气味。它刺激着鼻子，轻微地刺激着眼睛。花园里很安静，脚步声的声音回荡着。没有任何动物的迹象，甚至没有鸟类或啮齿动物，但植物生长旺盛，尽管缺少阳光和雨水的涌入。

items: 女王公园花园完全被深雾笼罩着（见{@area chapter 5|1ff|x}）

entries.name: Navigating the Garden
entries: 皇后公园花园将城市的街道、小巷和废墟换成了人行道、花园小径、花坛、纪念碑和森林小树林。因此，角色在该地区移动的方式与在城市街道上的移动方式一样。

entries.name: Searching the Garden
entries: 角色寻找eldritch lily必须尝试在一个小时内进行{@area Searching the Ruins|205|x}，如"{@area Navigating Drakkenheim|201|x}"在{@adventure chapter 5|DoDk|4}中描述。除了进行{@skill Investigation}检定外，角色还可以使用{@skill Arcana}、{@skill History}、{@skill Nature}或{@skill Survival}来帮助搜索花园。成功需要达到DC 15的检定结果，任何20或更高的检定结果都将额外获得一个成功。每次尝试角色找到的东西取决于他们的成功次数：

rows: 1 次成功或更少 (1 success or fewer)

entries: 两次或更多失败的检查结果会触发以下随机遭遇之一。不要忘记，角色每在这里度过一个小时都会暴露在深雾之中！
除非你想要一个草地侏儒的靴子踢在脸上，否则不要，我重申，不要去破坏花园。
我从来不懂植物学，但我觉得那些百合花很迷人。

entries.name: Random Encounters in Queen's Park
entries: 按照正常方式检查随机遭遇，当角色探索女王公园时，请使用这个表格来生成遭遇。

entries.name: Turned Around
entries: 角色们发现自己站在花园边缘附近，靠近众多通往庭园的入口之一。他们可以看到一排排建筑和街道，就在环绕花园的高大、长满苔藓的岩石墙之外。他们一定是在那边某个地方转错了方向。

entries.name: Garden Gnomes
entries: 一条细小的小路蜿蜒穿过一个草地空地。草地郁郁葱葱，或许是离城市十英里内最翠绿的草地。小路两旁是美丽装饰的花园。花园里开满了荧光紫色的花朵，点缀着橙色、黄色或绿色。它们并不是邪恶的百合花，但对于不熟悉的人来说，它们可能看起来是。进行一次DC 20 {@skill Nature}检定会发现它们是假的百合花。四个小花园侏儒站在花园里，两个分别站在两个花床的一端。如果玩家踏上草地或摘下任何花朵，他们会立刻听到一个声音尖叫着对他们说：“不要踩草地！”

items: 这些园艺侏儒是疯狂的侏儒{@creature Berserker||berserkers}，一旦有人干涉他们郁郁葱葱的花园，它们就会活过来并发动攻击。

entries.name: Weeping Willow
entries: 一棵看起来悲伤的柳树悬挂在一座被藤蔓覆盖的石桥前，这座石桥横跨在一个轻声潺潺的小瀑布下的小溪上。紫色和黄色充满活力的花朵盛开在石桥厚厚的藤蔓上。树在一阵诡异的微风中摇摆，系在树干上的一只小优雅划艇在小溪中轻轻摇晃。

items: 当玩家们走近这棵树时，它突然变得疯狂起来，如同一个疯狂的{@creature treant}。
在船上被遗弃的是一枚带有冯凯瑟尔家族纹章的小发夹，以及一本名为《(Skye花园)》的书，详细介绍了异国百合和其他植物。书的封面内有一段铭文，写着“献给我亲爱的母亲莱诺尔，卡塔琳娜”。
瀑布后面是一个十英尺宽的地下运河，一直延伸到黑暗中。这里没有人行道，在运河深处一千英尺处，水变成了浓稠的疯狂淤泥，是{@dice 1d4} {@creature Animated Delerium Sludge|DoDk|animated delerium sludges}的家园。运河轻轻弯曲，蜿蜒向上，最终在德拉肯城堡皇宫的水池中结束（见{@area chapter 9|5cb|x}）。

entries.name: Wight Knights
entries: 六名{@creature Haze Wight|DoDk|haze wights}在花园里徘徊，饥饿地攻击遇到的任何生物。他们身穿凯瑟尔伯爵家族的制服。

items: 其中一只尸鬼身上有一封信，上面印有皇家管家的印章（请参见{@area Steward's Letter|460|x}部分中的“{@area Developments|4af|x}”）。
根据便条上的信息，角色在下一次“{@area Searching the Garden|43f|x}”检定中获得优势。

entries.name: The Three Angels
entries: 三尊哭泣天使的雕像站在这片空地的中央，面向着中间。中央的雕像比另外两尊要大得多，被厚厚的藤蔓缠绕着，上面还长满了跳动的孢子。它们之间是一座被繁茂植物缠绕的古老石制讲台。

items: 移除植物后，露出了刻在石面上的花园地图。与雕像或地图的任何互动都会使三尊雕像栩栩如生：较小的两尊变成{@creature Gargoyle||gargoyles}，而较大的那尊使用{@creature vrock}的属性块。
研究地图可以让角色在下一次“{@area Searching The Garden|43f|x}”检定中获得优势。

entries.name: Ghost Lights
entries: 5 ({@dice 2d4}) {@creature Will-o'-Wisp||will-o-wisps} 漂浮在这片茂密树林中。如果被跟踪，它们会试图诱使角色走进树林，朝着被美丽发光的荧光花环环绕的小树林前进。一位死去的法师躺在花坛中央。

items: 任何检查尸体的人会引发一个立即敌对的复仇{@creature arcane wraith|DoDk}。幽灵和鬼火一起发动攻击。
尸体上有一件罕见的魔法物品，以及{@dice 1d4} 稀有 {@i potions} 或 {@item Spell Scroll||spell scrolls} 物品。

entries.name: Monument of The Queen's Men
entries: 这里安息着原始女王卫队的纪念碑。它描绘了一支专门保护德拉肯海姆女王的城堡卫兵团。这座纪念碑被现任女王卫队的歹徒用涂鸦和粗俗的画作玷污。纪念碑后面的一个古老洞穴曾经是一个营地，但现在成了2只饥饿的{@creature Troll||trolls}的家园。

items: 巨魔可以讨价还价，提供通往皇家洞穴的指引，那里有许多发光的花朵。作为交换，他们想要吃掉其中一个角色的肢体。
如果与巨魔讨价还价成功，角色在他们接下来的“{@area Searching the Garden|43f|x}”投掷中获得优势。

entries.name: Handmaidens Grove
entries: 在树篱之间，有一个美丽的修剪成优雅设计描绘神话生物的修剪成型花园。照料这个花园的是Lenore的{@creature Dryad||handmaidens}的7{@dice 2d6}。
这个小池塘被一层薄薄的藻类覆盖着，漂浮在闪闪发光的水面上。在水生植物中间，有三朵大黄睡莲。

items: 通过进行一次DC 10{@skill Investigation}检查，发现水被污染了。
这三朵花是{@creature Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom|DoDk|hypnotic eldritch blossoms}，试图诱使角色走向池塘。
如果水被打扰，{@creature animated delerium sludge|DoDk}会出现并发动攻击。

entries: 这个小人工池塘四周被棱镜状的樱花树环绕着。芦苇从泥泞的岸边涌现，水面下长满了一群藻类，水面上覆盖着一簇簇的睡莲。从水中盛开着几朵大型的睡莲花，花瓣呈现出明亮闪烁的粉紫色。它们散发出一种甜美奇异的气味，还伴随着一阵旋律优美的神秘嗡鸣。

items: 当角色在搜查花园({@area see above|43f|x})时，通过三次成功检查后找到这个地点。
站在被污染的水中的是5个女王的{@creature Dryad||handmaidens}(见上文{@area Interactions|3e0|x})，她们小心翼翼地采集百合花，准备带回皇家石窟给莱诺尔。
池塘里有5朵奥术百合在盛开，但也有2朵精灵莲花（{@dice 1d4}）（这些花朵无视女王的侍女们）。

entries.name: Royal Grotto
entries: 寻找eldritch lilies并取得四次成功的角色会找到皇家洞穴。
这座皇家花园装饰着豪华的石阶楼梯，带有有柱栏杆，沿着层层上升。主花园由两个大型闪亮的水池突显，四周铺满瓷砖石，而多朵百合花漂浮在闪烁的水面上，轻轻地脉动着一种神秘的光芒。几棵扭曲而美丽的樱花树点缀着花园的各个层次，永远处于盛开状态，而热粉红色、电兰色和霓虹紫色的花瓣轻轻飘落，将整个区域覆盖在色彩的波浪中。

喷泉的冒泡声和树叶被风吹拂的声音为花园增添了宁静的氛围，花园里摆放着许多身着奇装异服的高个女子雕像，她们的四肢优雅。每尊雕像的脸部都被凿去。在上层中央是一尊同样身着百合花的女性雕像，和其他雕像一样，脸部被雕刻掉了。淡色大理石墙将各层分隔开，上面雕刻着公主、皇后、少女和许多为凯瑟尔家族效劳的其他人的浮雕。苔藓、常春藤和不自然鲜艳的花朵附着在许多雕像和墙壁上。在楼梯和水池之间有一扇大铜门，经过多年的磨损，颜色发生了变化并氧化。门上有花纹边框，两个巨大的门把手造型像百合花。这扇门通往下方的岩洞。

items: 进入分层花园会唤醒 2 {@creature Shambling Mound||shambling mounds} 和 {@dice 2d4} {@creature Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom|DoDk|hypnotic eldritch blossoms}，它们试图诱使角色进入被污染的池塘。
一个由熟练技能的玩家进行的 DC 10 {@skill History} 检定可以确定这些雕像都是来自列诺尔·冯·凯瑟尔 (Lenore von Kessel)。

entries: 漫步皇后公园花园，就像走在过去皇室的小径上一样...但即使是最快的旅行，也可能让你少了一个三明治。
走下楼梯，来到一个圆形拱顶大厅，从地板到天花板装饰着马赛克。几何图案描绘了魔法水族人，如人鱼、仙女和水怪，愉快地参与着梦幻般奢华却又日常的活动：运动、享用美食、沐浴和与陆地爱人嬉戏。大厅凉爽宜人，弥漫着一股愉悦的潮湿气味；潺潺流水的声音在走廊中回荡。
在房间的中央是一个圆形喷泉，上面摆放着一个女神般的雕像，手持三叉戟和一个花瓶。水从喷口中涌出，将喷泉注满清澈的水。喷泉周围和内部摆放着绘制的陶瓷花瓶、玻璃收藏品和散落的硬币。
镶嵌画延伸沿着通往东西的短走廊，最终通往类似结构的小房间。拱门上设有铁栅栏铁门，分别在三个地方镂空在墙壁上。每个通向一个粗糙凿制的阶梯洞穴通道，轻轻向下倾斜，同时急剧向南扭转。

items: 精通石匠工具或具有石头感知能力的角色可以看出这些洞穴通道完全是人工制造的，而不是自然形成的洞穴。
10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@creature Dryad||handmaidens} 出现在根系中的以下房间内，利用他们的{@i tree stride}力量，试图最后一搏驱赶入侵者。

entries: Two yawning stone pipes disgorge streams of sweet-smelling water into a pool in this cavernous chamber. The water is luminescent with a pinkish-purple sheen. Thick roots from the trees above have broken through the walls to sip the collected water. The pond empties gently down a passage that bends southwest.

items: The pool is three feet deep, and the water within is contaminated. The pipe openings are about a foot wide.

entries: The stepped caverns converge in a rectangular chamber. Part of the chamber is finished stonework, the rest remains roughly hewn. Several statues have been carved directly from the rock. The finished chamber contains twenty statues depicting Lenore von Kessel lining the long walls. A large statue of the royal family sits at the end of this chamber, depicting King Ulrich, Queen Lenore, and their two daughters. The faces of any statue depicting Queen Lenore have been sheared off.

items: An inscription on the family monument reads "...for my lovely Lenore, on the anniversary of our royal union."—King Ulrich von Kessel IV

entries: An underground pond fills most of this large artificial cavern, filled by a flowing stream to the west. The water glows softly with prismatic light, and across the surface are dozens of purple-pink eldritch lilies. The great roots from the trees above have broken through the ceiling in places to drink deeply from the lambent water.

An exquisitely upholstered velvet chaise lounge with gold-painted armrests and plush pillows is set atop several overlapping woven rugs. Scattered around the furnishings lies the extensive baggage train of a fabulously wealthy noblewoman. A mahogany chest of drawers is overflowing with pompous gowns, fashionable dresses, multicoloured wigs, oversized hats, and fantastically impractical shoes. An oaken coffer is brimming with elaborate jewellery, and several smaller containers, suitcases, and baskets are overstuffed with more clothing, artwork, gems, and coins.

Several portraits and paintings are arranged about the chamber. Many paintings show a noblewoman wearing a golden necklace set with eleven emeralds, but within each the face has been torn off. One painting shows the woman posing with a noble family: a young teen man, two girls - one perhaps eight, the other no more than five - and a portly and bearded man wearing a crown.

items.name: Lenore
items.entry: resides here. If anyone touches the eldritch lilies or provokes her flaws, she tears away her veil and attacks while prismatic light emanates from her eyes, nose, and mouth.

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: Queen Lenore's emerald necklace is worth 10,000 gp. However, the necklace is famous. Anyone with the coinage to {@i buy} it knows that it would be immediately recognized as belonging to the royal family. Lenore wears a diamond-set {@item ring of protection} bearing the royal seal. The other costumes and accoutrements here are mostly ruined, but {@dice 1d4} pieces worth 250 gp are salvageable. {@dice 1d6} {@adventure delerium crystals|DoDk|13|Delerium} and {@dice 2d6} {@adventure shards|DoDk|13|Delerium} can be harvested here.

items.name: Eldritch Lilies
items.entry: Lenore's {@creature Dryad||handmaidens} have collected 35 ({@dice 10d6}) eldritch lilies and gathered them in the pool here, but they don't normally grow in this location.

entries.name: Developments
entries: Characters may have come to Queen's Park seeking flowers, but could leave with a royal problem.

entries.name: Lenore
entries: Lenore can be kept tranquil or pacified by characters who play into her delusions, or temporarily {@condition blinded} if she sees her own face. It may be possible to capture her or bring her out of the Garden, but as a contaminated creature she'll die in a few days if taken outside the Haze.

The former Queen is a powerful symbol of the old monarchy. As such, should Elias Drexel and the Hooded Lanterns learn of her survival, they demand Lenore be placed under their custody in the Drakkenheim Garrison. If the characters accept, the Hooded Lanterns reward the characters with an appropriate boon for their deed. This act alone cements the support of the Hooded Lanterns, and they'll look favourably upon an alliance with another faction the characters might be working alongside. However, should the characters refuse, the Hooded Lanterns cast them as royal kidnappers. Elias Drexel expends every effort to rescue Lenore and bring the party to justice.

If Lenore was killed and the characters inform Hooded Lanterns, the soldiers are devastated, but don't seek retribution. They understand the characters did what they had to do against a contaminated monster. Even still, this blunder means Elias Drexel no longer believes the characters have the best interests of Drakkenheim in mind. Unless they prove otherwise through greater deeds, the Hooded Lanterns become ambivalent about working with the party in the future.

entries.name: Curing Lenore
entries: Unfortunately, the Hooded Lanterns don't possess the means to reverse Lenore's transformation, and must turn to the other factions for help:

items: The Silver Order makes an honest effort to use cleric spells to cure Lenore, but this fails. As such, they suggest a swift and merciful death is the most honorable course for a contaminated creature such as Lenore. They demand the Hooded Lanterns euthanize her as a condition for any future alliance.

The Amethyst Academy offers to help find a way to reverse her transformation in return for help retaking the Inscrutable Tower. They suggest the characters seek out the Pale Man to acquire his research. If these works are turned over to the Academy, the mages will aid the characters in developing the {@spell siphon contamination|DoDk} spell.

The Queen of Thieves suspects a wish from the Crown of Westemär could be used to cure Lenore, but reveals this information carefully. Naturally, if the Hooded Lanterns keep Lenore in the Drakkenheim Garrison, the Queen's Men stage a kidnapping attempt for ransom!

The Followers of the Falling Fire don't care much for the old monarchy, but Lucretia Mathias offers to call upon her divine powers to restore Lenore to her human form. This requires a great show of faith: Lucrecia Mathias only agrees to perform the miracle if Elias Drexel and the Hooded Lanterns leadership agree to join the Followers of the Falling Fire by taking the Sacrament.

entries.name: Queen-Regent
entries: If her transformation is somehow reversed, Lenore has the statistics of a human {@creature noble}. While she could possibly take up the throne as a Queen-Regent, this is an extremely dubious claim. Lenore was wed into House von Kessel, and so her political authority comes from her spouse and children. Worse, while Lenore adores the trappings of power and wealth, she loathes actual political responsibility. She wields her influence for personal gain only. Still, she could prove instrumental in confirming the identity of her offspring, but she doesn't know where they are or what happened to them.

entries.name: Eldritch Lilies and Aqua Expurgo
entries: Creating one dose of {@item aqua expurgo|DoDk} requires alchemical tools and eight hours of work by a character who knows the formula and can cast spells of 3rd level or higher. The recipe calls for one eldritch lily flower, 150 gp in alchemical reagents, and two ounces of blood taken from a contaminated monster.
Oscar Yoren and his apprentices can produce the potion given the materials, as can the Amethyst Academy, the Hooded Lanterns, and the Followers of the Falling Fire if they are given the formula.

entries.name: Cultivating an Eldritch Lily Garden
entries: Rather than continually revisiting the garden to acquire more flowers, inventive characters might propose creating a garden of their own. Characters who carefully collect two dozen complete eldritch lily plants - not just the flowers - can begin their own plot. They'll need a location within the Haze with ample contaminated water, as eldritch lily plants taken out of the Haze wilt and die within twenty four hours. The strongholds of the Followers of the Falling Fire and the Hooded Lanterns, as well as Reed Manor, are suitable sites for a safely accessible lily garden, but the Amethyst Academy has the means to create one at their remote strongholds as well.

This ensures a consistent supply of reagents for crafting {@item aqua expurgo|DoDk}, and working with a faction or Oscar Yoren allows each character to receive one dose at the outset of any mission. Characters who wish to create additional doses must either do so themselves or provide extra gold and materials to ensure the garden isn't overfarmed.

entries.name: Johann Eisner, Royal Steward
entries: Please excuse the haste of this missive, and the messenger who bears it. Our present circumstances are both dire and desperate.

I have charged this man with ensuring your safety during this calamity. He is a valiant knight, and will escort you and your handmaids out of Drakkenheim. It is imperative you flee the castle immediately via the garden passage.
Do not return to the royal apartments, nor take the main castle gate.
I beg you, your Majesty, do not wait for anyone else, nor burden yourself with trinkets and treasures, nor tarry in the gardens! Escape the city with all speed.
I promise, my queen, I shall not leave myself without the king and your son. I pray that your daughters remain safe. We shall all meet again in health and mirth soon.
Yours in faithful service,

entries.name: Rose Theatre
entries: The Rose Theatre was the latest in a long line of playhouses in Drakkenheim that typically remained for a few decades before horribly burning down. The three story circular theatre with a thrust stage and open-air auditorium was once a hub for popular entertainment in the city. Throngs of common folk attended bawdy comedies, exaggerated and bloody histories, and dramatic tragedies written by highly competitive bards. Now it lays abandoned within the Haze, devoid of any laughter, music, or applause.

entries.name: Overview
entries: In this adventure, characters explore the mysterious Rose Theatre, which is oddly sheltered from the city ruins by an invisible barrier, guarded by uncontaminated elemental creatures and arcane constructs. Here, the characters encounter Ryan Greymere, a talented {@creature archmage} who abandoned the Amethyst Academy. Though she has been branded a malfeasant wizard, Ryan Greymere doesn't practice contaminated magic, unlike Oscar Yoren and the Pale Man. Instead, she's crafted a potent suit of magic armour that protects against contamination.

It's up to the player characters how to deal with her. They can slay her to claim her magic items and seize her spellbooks, but could gain much by negotiating with her. They might even be able to broker an agreement to admit her back into the Amethyst Academy.

entries.name: Dangerous Minds
entries: Ryan Greymere has been in the sights of the Amethyst Academy for some time. Although she was a dear friend of Eldrick Runeweaver, she was also a fierce rival. They want to know what she is up to in the ruins and what her research has uncovered about delerium.

entries.name: Misguided Mage
entries: Knights of the Silver Order would like to see her brought to justice. As a practitioner of magic who has abandoned the Edicts of Lumen, the Silver Order believes it is their duty to destroy her research and bring Ryan Greymere in for imprisonment, but they are just as happy if the players take her down.

entries.name: Interactions
entries: Ryan Greymere aggressively responds to intruders into the Rose Theatre, but intends to incapacitate trespassers so she can find out why they are there. Since she is hiding alone in the Inner City under magical defenses, she expects anyone who has penetrated the magical barrier is an Amethyst Academy assassin sent to kill her. However, she'll stay her hand if intruders attempt parley, but she'll try to flee before she can be captured.

entries.name: Ryan Greymere
entries: Once highly regarded within the Amethyst Academy, Ryan Greymere's trailblazing research led to many early discoveries about delerium, and she designed many of the procedures used by the Academy to make magic items using the crystals. However, she shocked the Directorate by presenting a dramatic plan for the Amethyst Academy to overtly seize control of Drakkenheim by force. Such action would grossly overstep the Edicts of Lumen, but Greymere flippantly replied that the realms and clergy were in no place to actually enforce the Edicts anymore. As a result, she was branded malfeasant, disavowed by the Academy, and most insultingly, the Directorate took credit for her discoveries. She fled into Drakkenheim, and now plans on gaining access to the Inscrutable Tower and continuing her research in private.
Ryan Greymere is a human woman in her mid-forties. Armoured head to toe and wearing white robes, her spectral appearance has garnered her the moniker the "Iron Banshee".

items.name: Personality Trait
items.entry: Get to the point on a topic that excites me, or don't waste my time.

items.name: Ideal
items.entry: Only wizards can unlock the mysteries of delerium and protect the world from the Haze, but we cannot do that if we are hindered by the Edicts of Lumen.

items.name: Bond
items.entry: I greatly miss my friends and colleagues in the Amethyst Academy, but I'm furious about the way I was treated by the Directorate.

items.name: Flaw
items.entry: I'm not wasting my time with boot-licking fools looking to restore a worthless monarchy.

entries: Ryan Gremere is a human {@creature archmage} who wears {@item hazewalker plate|DoDk}, {@item Winged Boots||boots of flying}, and carries a {@item wand of lightning bolts}.
In addition to the spells she has prepared, her spellbook contains {@spell purge contamination|DoDk}, {@spell ride the rifts|DoDk}, and {@spell octarine spray|DoDk}.

entries.name: Survival in the Haze
entries: Ryan Greymere uses the {@spell Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion||magnificent mansion} spell each day to conjure a sanctuary where she can rest. She doesn't keep living quarters in the theatre.

entries.name: Bound Elementals
entries: Ryan Greymere's elementals were conjured and bound to her service via {@spell planar binding} and unquestionably obey her.
The Rose Theatre is a ring-shaped three-storey wooden playhouse with the central auditorium open to the sky.

entries.name: Force Barrier
entries: The whole theatre is protected by a hemispherical {@spell wall of force} generated by a massive {@adventure delerium geode|DoDk|13|Delerium}. The barrier encloses the entire building, its perimeter about twenty feet outside the walls and about fifty feet above the rooftops of the theatre.

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by {@spell dispel magic}. A {@spell disintegrate} spell destroys the wall instantly, however it reforms ten minutes later. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall. Teleportation magic can bypass the wall, such as a {@spell dimension door} or {@spell misty step} spell.

entries.name: Playhouse
entries: The playhouse is a circular open air auditorium with a rectangular stage. Most performances were held here during daylight hours to use natural lighting.

entries.name: The Stage
entries: This large rectangular wooden platform is built at the north end of the auditorium, connected to the backstage house by exits leading into the wings. Two large wooden pillars support an overhanging rooftop that extends from the backstage house.

items: Ryan Greymere has set up her arcane lab upon the stage.

entries.name: Balcony Galleries
entries: These wooden and pillared galleries are set with several raked rows of wooden benches, separated by evenly-spaced aisles. At the centre is a special box seat for the wealthiest patrons, and many disintegrating cushions, pamphlets, bits of old food and pitchers are left behind.

entries.name: Auditorium
entries: This gravel-filled courtyard has no seating: commonfolk stood here to watch performances instead. It is open to the air above.

items: An {@creature air elemental} and a {@creature water elemental} patrol here.

entries.name: Barrier Generator
entries: This complex arcane apparatus set up on the stage powers the force barrier. Anchored by a {@adventure delerium geode|DoDk|13|Delerium}, it requires a constant supply of delerium to maintain. It has AC 20 and 100 hit points. If destroyed, the force barrier fails, triggering a random {@adventure arcane anomaly|DoDk|13|Arcane Anomalies}.

entries.name: Backstage
entries: The backstage house is a rectangular construction built into the overall circular shape of the entire theatre that contains the storage and administrative offices of the theatre.

entries.name: The Wings
entries: Mouldering red curtains are hung over the doorways leading into this narrow carpeted hallway. During performances actors made their entrances and exits via this corridor; it connects the stage to the green rooms backstage. There are many shelves holding old props, several cracked mirrors, and old lamps back here. Actors have left behind notes, love-letters, and graffiti.

entries.name: Green Room
entries: Actors waiting for their cue rested here during a performance, and socialized here between performances. Bottles of wine, flower bouquets, fluttering pages from play scripts, and notebooks filled with poems, sonnets and bawdy drawings are scattered about.

entries.name: Wardrobes
entries: Contains an array of costumes. Many appear fantastically decorated, but even casual inspection reveals the gemstones and gold trim are glass beads and painted fakery.

entries.name: Dressing Room
entries: Actors donned their costumes and makeup in these rooms. Several broken mirrors and drawers of powder, wigs, and makeup are still here.

entries.name: Offices
entries: The writers and managers used these rooms. Writing desks, old playbills, and records of the ticket sales can be found here. A lockbox holds the funds, totalling 1,000 gp.

entries.name: Developments
entries: As long as the player characters agree to help Ryan Greymere she is willing to grant them access to her research. Characters who either obtain her notes, or work with her can find the following.

entries.name: Ryan Greymere's Research
entries: Characters can learn the following from speaking with Ryan Greymere or studying her writing:

items.name: Formation of Delerium Crystals
items.entry: "Magic attracts more magic. Under extraordinarily rare circumstances, magical energies crystallize into delerium. The stones slowly draw more raw magic into the world from distant planes, possible realities, and alternate dimensions. The rate is exponential. Considerably more leakage occurs around vast quantities of delerium. These chaotic energies are inherently destabilizing. Unfocused magic conjures up paradoxical improbabilities at random, leaving behind lingering eldritch contamination. Uncontained, these magical forces manifest as the Haze. More delerium forms within, and so the process accelerates."

items.name: Emergence of Dimensional Rifts
items.entry: "As it expands, the Haze both transforms the landscape, but it also conjures magical energy from the Space Between Worlds. I'm concerned that in areas where magic was already concentrated or where the borders between worlds are thin, it could result in catastrophic dimensional rifts."

items.name: Possible containment
items.entry: "Delerium presents an existential danger, but also opportunity. The concentration of delerium in Drakkenheim could provide an infinite supply of magical energy if directly harnessed, rather than simply crafting items individually. I've found promising results so far at collecting the energy given off by the stones - the problem is storage and containment. The abjurations required are just outside my wheelhouse. If it could be accomplished at-scale, not only would it be possible to fuel endless magical creations, it might actually slow the growth of the Haze, even hold it at equilibrium."

items.name: Hazewalker Plate and Bottled Comet Schematics
items.entry: Ryan Gremere's research notes include the formula and blueprints to create these items (See {@adventure Appendix D|DoDk|13}).

entries: Ryan Greymere keeps her research within a {@spell Leomund's Secret Chest||secret chest}. If she's killed, the contents become forever lost on the Ethereal Plane.

entries.name: Ryan Greymere's Wishes
entries: Ryan Greymere wants to be allowed to continue her research in Drakkenheim and is upfront with characters about her relationship with the Academy, and her disdain for the monarchy. She scoffs at the idea of restoring the royal bloodline, and feels the world is better off without kings and queens. If player characters decide to help Ryan Greymere, she asks that they bring her a {@adventure delerium geode|DoDk|13|Delerium} for each character who wants {@item Hazewalker Plate|DoDk}. She will construct the armour for the characters but she requires access to the Inscrutable Tower.

entries.name: Rejoining the Academy
entries: Ryan Greymere holds no grudges against Eldrick Runeweaver or River, but is very open with her opinions on the Academy Directorate. However, she understands that a lot of their decisions are forced on them by the Edicts of Lumen, and regards the Silver Order and the oppression of mageborn responsible for limiting her potential to help the world and solve the issues of Drakkenheim. It may be possible for characters to convince the Academy to set aside their feud and have Ryan Greymere join once more. Ultimately, she would most like to be elected Archmage of Drakkenheim, but she might also collaborate with Eldrick Runeweaver. In either case, she proves to be a valuable asset, and her research and inventions could greatly advance the Academy's goals. Unfortunately, Ryan Greymere's fierce political opinions may complicate attempts to have the Amethyst Academy collaborate with other factions.

entries.name: Crafting Hazewalker Plate
entries: Building a suit of {@item Hazewalker Plate|DoDk} requires magically-enchanted smithing tools and a well-equipped arcane forge (such facilities can only be found within the Inscrutable Tower or other distant Amethyst Academy strongholds). It takes thirty days of work by a character who knows the schematics and can cast spells of 7th level or higher. The recipe calls for one delerium geode, 10,000 gp in alchemical reagents, and five ingots of refined meteoric iron in addition to enough conventional steel and materials for making either half-plate or plate. Ryan Greymere can craft a suit given facilities and materials, as can the Amethyst Academy.

entries.name: Saint Vitruvio's Cathedral
entries: Saint Vitruvio was a mighty paladin of the Sacred Flame, the patron saint of Drakkenheim. Along with the ancient gold dragon Argonath, this righteous warrior saved Drakkenheim from a marauding army led by chromatic dragons that descended upon Westemär from the eastern vale centuries ago. Argonath gave their life in that battle, and Saint Vitruvio subsequently died slaying the half-dragon warlock behind the terrible scourge. Their bones and equipment have been kept as holy relics since, as Saint Vitruvio prophesied the gold dragon could be resurrected should Drakkenheim ever fall to darkness.

This gargantuan Cathedral of the Sacred Flame was built to house their remains. However, it is a relatively recent construction, only completed a little over a century ago to replace another large chapel that was torn down during the expansion of the city walls. Long before, the site was home to several crypts and crematory gardens, and the dead are still interred in the catacombs below the contemporary building. Following its completion, worshippers would travel for miles around to make prayers and offerings to the Sacred Flame here. After the meteor fell, these hallowed halls became a charnel house - the lair of the monstrous {@creature Lord of the Feast|DoDk}.

entries.name: Overview
entries: In this adventure, the player characters must spearhead an assault or infiltration into Saint Vitruvio's Cathedral, where they will face off against a terrifying garmyr warband. Then characters may explore the catacombs below to recover the relics within. The cathedral is one place that can bring all the factions together, but in the aftermath their disagreements blossom into open conflict.

entries.name: Reclaim the Cathedral
entries: Once characters have secured passage through a city gate, obtained at least one Seal of Drakkenheim, claimed the clocktower, and otherwise proven their competence and trustworthiness to either the Hooded Lanterns, the Silver Order, the Followers of the Falling Fire, or the Queen of Thieves, they are approached by a faction leader about leading an assault on the cathedral.

items: For the Followers of the Falling Fire and the Silver Order, the cathedral is an important spiritual landmark. Not only are many important holy relics kept here, but also the magical brazier of the Sacred Flame could be re-ignited. Its protective aura might even hold back the Haze, at least around the cathedral.

Both the Queen of Thieves and the Hooded Lanterns wish to access the House von Kessel vaults located beneath the cathedral. This important archive may include copies of the king's will or other documents outlining the line of succession, and possibly other political secrets.

Finally, the {@item Saint Vitruvio's Phylactery|DoDk|High Flamekeeper's Phylactery} is believed to be lost here. As one of the six {@i Seals of Drakkenheim}, its recovery is essential if there is to one day be a new monarch... or someone wishes to use the power of the throne. Except for the Amethyst Academy, every faction wants to recover it.
The Amethyst Academy doesn't have a personal interest in recovering the cathedral. However, they may throw their support behind one of the other factions to garner favour with them later.

entries.name: Interactions
entries: A direct attack by the player characters alone is likely folly, so they should seek aid from the factions to defeat the Lord of the Feast.

entries.name: Faction Alliance
entries: Many factions can accomplish key objectives at the cathedral, which the characters can use to facilitate cooperation between them. This is one of the few moments in the campaign where all the factions are willing to pool their resources and work together with the player characters, so long as the following conditions are met by the characters:

items: Demonstrated their trustworthiness and full loyalty to the faction's ideals and goals.
Acquired at least one {@i Seal of Drakkenheim}.
Secured the clocktower and Temple Gate.
Created an alliance with two other factions.

entries: The factions must keep a reserve force and a garrison for their current holdings, so each can only work with a few strike teams for this operation. Plus, large numbers of people moving in the city will attract more monsters, and quickly. They propose an assault mission by the player characters supported by a handful of faction strike teams.

items: {@creature Lord Commander Elias Drexel|DoDk|Elias Drexel} and {@creature Knight-Captain Theodore Marshal|DoDk|Theodore Marshal} are both willing to personally join the battle, and the other factions offer up boons in advance to help the characters.
The Inner City is filled with monsters, so moving material, troops, or large traps into the city over time is difficult and limited to what individual people can carry and set up in the field.
Once the cathedral is taken, the factions will post troops there on rotating shifts to defend it, but this will leave their forces stretched quite thin as a result.

entries.name: Planning the Attack
entries: The player characters should be instrumental in planning the attack on the cathedral and devising a way to bring down the Lord of the Feast with the faction leaders. A decisive blow must be struck. The factions can't fight a battle of attrition in the streets or hold ground in the city because their troops will quickly become contaminated. The factions can provide a few doses of {@item aqua expurgo|DoDk} or cast {@spell purge contamination|DoDk} to heal an individual strike team, but none of the factions can afford to do this en masse.

items: The best intelligence and scouting reports the factions have indicates that the garmyr number in the hundreds, perhaps even as many as two thousand. While slaying the Lord of the Feast won't suddenly cause the garmyr to disappear, it should break any cohesion between the warbands.

If the characters are having trouble coming up with a plan, one of the faction leaders might suggest trying to draw out the Lord of the Feast with bait of some kind. Then, faction strike teams can lure away the bulk of the garmyr with a diversion, while the player characters take down the Lord of the Feast (possibly with a faction leader). Embrace your player's creativity in coming up with what might be suitable bait and what might be a good diversion!

entries.name: Lord of the Feast
entries: Game statistics for this monstrous creature can be found in {@creature Lord of the Feast|DoDk|Appendix A}.

items.name: Personality Trait
items.entry: I live for the hunt, and enjoy nothing more than fresh meat.

items.name: Ideal
items.entry: It is the right of the strong to consume the weak.

items.name: Bond
items.entry: Drakkenheim is the perfect hunting ground for an alpha predator such as myself.

items.name: Flaw
items.entry: I am gripped with bloodlust that only subsides when I rest in the cathedral.

entries: Broad cobblestone streets wrap around an immense baroque cathedral in this august square. The structure dominates the plaza, completely dwarfing the nearby buildings with a two-hundred-fifty-foot-tall spired central dome that looms large over the gently sloping terracotta rooftops of the surrounding townhouses. The main dome is flanked by four stocky towers meticulously decorated with religious iconography and angelic sculptures. Between each are semicircular apses lined with stained glass windows fifty feet high, thus the building has a roughly square footprint. The outer facade has rows of alcoves containing life-size statues of valiant paladins and devoted clerics. Broad steps lead up to the columned entrance portico where a massive rose window rests above three sets of golden double doors embossed with heavenly visages.

Splayed out before the majestic building is a sprawling and ramshackle camp of makeshift hovels, smoking pyres, and improvised barricades. Tall wooden stakes are driven into the ground along the streets, displaying macabre trophies of bones, ribcages, skulls, and body parts. Guttural yelps and furious howls echo down the streets, and the overpowering scent of decaying offal, feces, and wet animal fur wafts about the haze-filled courtyard.

items: 70 ({@dice 20d6}) {@creature Gnoll||garmyr} and 14 ({@dice 4d6}) {@creature Worg||worgs} devour their latest kills in the encampment.

entries: The Cathedral of Saint Vitruvio houses a vast interior space. A monumental rotunda topped with a two-hundred-fifty-foot-high dome forms the central sanctuary where the Brazier of the Sacred Flame is set. The ribbed roof features an elaborate fresco depicting an angelic host descending from on high, lifting the wretched and the lost towards a divine light symbolized by a blazing sun. A row of stout yawning windows rings the base of the dome, bordered by multifaceted mirrors that create angular beams of light leaving spotlights on the floor and walls around the central altar.

Four halls extend in each cardinal direction like wheel spokes from the rotunda. Colossal marble columns decorated with cherubs line the aisles down each and support high vaulted ceilings one hundred twenty feet overhead. Murals upon the ceilings of the naves and aisles depict scenes of saints, angels, and martyrs performing righteous acts of mercy, compassion, and sacrifice. Each hall ends in a semicircular apse set with arched stained glass windows fifty feet high, except the southern hall that serves as the main entrance, above which is a rose window.

Unnatural hues from outside flood this once holy place through the many windows, and cast the chambers in an unsettling and otherworldly pallor. The sanctuary has been defiled by the countless carcasses of the garmyr's many slaughters. Broken bones and severed limbs are strewn about carpets of stretched skin and furry hide. Debris and refuse are caked into the cracks and crevices, vibrant red blood smears the floors and walls. Flensing blades, barbed chains, and meat hooks dangle from the torch sconces. Unrecognizable forms of hanging meat decorate the elaborate chandeliers above. At the heart of the cathedral is a tiered platform upon which rests a five-foot-wide granite brazier. Instead of a glorious golden flame, piled within is a mountain of blood-soaked skulls.

items: During the day, the {@creature Lord of the Feast|DoDk} rests here with 14 ({@dice 4d6}) garmyr {@creature Berserker||berserkers}, and 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@creature Hell Hound||hell hounds}. The great beast hunts nightly from dusk till dawn when only 7 ({@dice 2d6}) {@creature Berserker||berserkers}, and 4 ({@dice 1d6}) {@creature Hell Hound||hell hounds} remain behind.

A mutated garmyr {@creature chaplain|DoDk} wearing the tattered robes of a Flamekeeper conducts blasphemous rites before the altar of skulls. It carries the {@item Saint Vitruvio's Phylactery|DoDk|High Flamekeeper's Phylactery}.

entries.name: Catacomb Passages
entries: Two arched doorways with oak doors open to staircases that descend down into the cathedral catacombs. Both doors are brightly illuminated by beams of light created by the reflecting mirrors in the dome above.

entries.name: Sidechambers
entries: Small groups of garmyr have claimed these rooms as their own, and each is now in a state of disarray and gore.

entries.name: Bell Towers
entries: The central dome of Saint Vitruvio's is anchored by four great bell towers. The lower floors are great galleries where statues and artworks are displayed, with the belfrys accessed by narrow staircases and ladders.

entries.name: Chandlery
entries: This western side room is a workshop for making the many candles, holy oils, and flammable fluids used in the holy ceremonies of the Sacred Flame.

entries.name: Sacristy
entries: These eastern rooms are where the Flamekeepers donned their vestments, prepared for their sermons, conducted personal meetings, and meditated privately. A small loft houses a few cots used by the nightkeepers, but most of the clergy lived at Saint Selina's Monastery.

entries.name: Vestibules
entries: Since the cathedral could be packed with thousands of worshippers on high holy days, these additional entrances helped ensure the flood of people could easily enter and exit.

entries.name: Cathedral Catacombs
entries: Beneath the cathedral dome lies an ancient burial crypt for former paladins and Flamekeepers who pledged their life in service to the Sacred Flame. The Lord of the Feast and his warpack leave these hallowed halls abandoned and forgotten, instead seeking fresh meat in the city ruins.

entries.name: Light Beam Puzzle
entries: The treasures of the Cathedral of Saint Vitruvio are sealed behind warded doors of stone, which slide open only when a beam of heavenly light is shone into the aperture lenses upon them. A beam of light originates above each of the Ascendant Archangel statues (detailed below), then characters must direct the beams down the halls by bouncing the light from mirrored shields found throughout the catacombs. Solving the puzzle requires placing the varying numbers of shields in specific positions then facing them in different directions to open the doors.

items: The locations marked 'X' on the map indicate the approximate position where a character can hold a shield to bounce the beams, which then reflects at a ninety-degree angle towards another glyph in line with the previous glyph (think "connect the dots"). Characters can hold the shields themselves or prop them up with objects if needed.

entries.name: Aperture Doors
entries: These stone doors are eighteen inches thick and made of heavy granite. There are no seams, hinges, handles, or locks upon these doors save an embedded bronze aperture set with a thick glass lens at the centre. Peering through provides a distorted view of the chamber beyond. Engravings on each door depict resolute paladins and righteous heroes of the Sacred Flame.

items: The magically warded doors are immune to all damage, and magic can't alter their forms.
A door slides open once a Heavenly Beam (see below) is shone into the aperture, and remains open for eight hours thereafter.

entries.name: Heavenly Beams
entries: Light is collected above the cathedral dome and shines down upon the Ascendant Archangels, where it becomes a clearly visible magical beam of heavenly light. These beams do not harm creatures or damage objects, and travel in straight lines. They can only be reflected off mirrored shields found in the crypts or those borne by the Ascendant Archangels. Any other reflective surface causes the beams to fizzle out.

entries.name: Mirrored Shields
entries: Six silver shields with brilliant reflective surfaces are hidden throughout the catacombs. Each weighs twenty pounds and is entirely impractical for actual defense, and don't have any other properties beyond reflecting the heavenly beams. Either side of the shield can reflect the heavenly beams, obeying the laws of reflection, although solving the puzzles in the crypt only requires the beams be bounced at hard ninety-degree angles.

entries.name: Holy Wards
entries: {@spell Hallow} spells ward the House von Kessel vault, the tomb of Saint Vitruvio, the Vault of Ignacious, and Argonath's Rest. Creatures can't teleport into these areas.

entries.name: Alcoves of the Ascendant Archangels
entries: Descending either set of stairs from the cathedral sanctuary above leads to similar passageways:

The stairs descend into a short corridor with a semicircular alcove at one end. The opposite way leads to a crossed intersection of arched passageways heading in each cardinal direction. Inside the alcove is a magnificent ten-foot-tall marble statue of an angelic figure set upon a pedestal. The angel holds a weapon in one hand, and in the other bears a round silver shield polished to a mirror-like sheen. A column of light shines down from a hole in the ceiling above, illuminating the sculpture in a beam of heavenly light.

items: The statues depict the Archangels Gabrielle (east alcove) and Michael (west), who hold a spear and sword respectively. Characters proficient in the {@skill Religion} skill automatically recognize them; they are the angels who guided Saint Tarna down the path of a paladin.

The shields are magically secured to each statue. However, the angels' arms are articulated. A character can use an action to move and rotate the shield into a forty five degree angle in relation to the floor, which sends the beam of heavenly light straight down the passageway directly away from the alcoves.
Characters can place a mirrored shield in the intersection to bounce light north or south.
An inscription on each statue reads "The light opens the way of truth."

entries: These long rooms are lined with ancient stone slabs laid out with the mummified remains of clerics and paladins of the Sacred Flame, the bodies simply adorned with a single trinket or weapons from their former lives. Each clutches a holy symbol in their hands, and has smooth stones placed upon their eyes. Surrounding each stone platform are dozens of candles in various shapes and sizes. The tombs here are untouched and covered in thick dust. The stone slab floor and low ceilings paired with the many tombs and niches lined with skulls ever watching those who enter make even these large and spacious rooms feel claustrophobic and unsettling.

entries.name: Mummified Clergy
entries: Each chamber houses the mummified remains of clerics and paladins of the Sacred Flame. Although the dead are normally cremated, the faithful believe these blessed souls may one day return to their earthly bodies in a desperate time when the Sacred Flame enact its will through corporeal vessels. Their bodies are wrapped in linen cloth, and dressed with bits of clothing, armour, or weapons they used in life. Inscriptions, tapestries, and painted murals decorate each sarcophagus niche, telling the life and deeds of the dead. Finally, 10 ({@dice 3d6}) candles are arranged around each sarcophagus. A holy rite allows the candles to remain lit eternally without being consumed, but they can be doused as normal.

items: Each is a {@creature mummy} that lies in state. Last rites performed over them decades ago hold back the reanimating magic of the Haze. They do not rise unless their remains or possessions are disturbed, in which case the nearby candles snuff out, and they attack as unhinged and violent undead. They have the following additional trait:

{@b {@i Rejuvenation}.} If the mummy is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in ten minutes, unless its remains are placed upon the stone slab, surrounded with lit candles, sprinkled with holy water, and a short prayer uttered over it, or a {@spell gentle repose} or {@spell remove curse} is cast upon its remains.
{@b {@i Treasure}.} Each mummy has gemstones placed over their eye sockets worth 100 gp each. They also clutch a gold or silver holy symbol of the Sacred Flame worth 50 gp.

entries.name: [1] Western Tombs
entries: The candles of this great hall are lit with ever-burning flames that cause a dance of dim light across the various tombs and niches throughout. Shadows cast upon the walls and floor flitter with an ambience of warmth and welcome.

items: The door to this chamber opens immediately when the arms of Michael in the west Ascendant Archangel alcove are switched to a forty-five-degree angle.
The {@creature Mummy||mummies} here remain dormant unless disturbed.

One of the niches is empty, but there is a small circular aperture filled with glass on the wall. Bouncing light into it from a mirrored shield causes the wall to slide open into a dusty room, which contains {@dice 1d4} rare {@item Spell Scroll||spell scrolls} from the cleric spell list and another mirrored shield.

entries.name: [2] Southwest Tombs
entries: The candles of this hall have all gone out, casting the room in a cold darkness. The deafening silence of the hall of dead is eerie. Upon one of the ancient tombs lies a shining shield that just catches the light drifting down from the stairs. The shield is clutched in the hands of the mummified remains of a great saint.

items: Opening the aperture door to this chamber requires using one mirror shield; bouncing light from the west Ascendant Archangel alcove, placed at the west intersection.
All the candles in this tomb have gone out, and the {@creature Mummy||mummies} interred here are mad. They rise and attack if any enter the chamber, and the mirrored shield clatters to the ground.
The mummies must be laid to rest properly to keep them from rising again ({@area see above|49b|x}).

entries.name: [3] Eastern Tombs
entries: Several of the candles in this room have gone out except for three of the stone slabs still illuminated in the dim light. At the back of the room a statue of a great Flamekeeper sits clutching a shining shield that reflects the candlelight of the room.

items: The door to this chamber opens immediately when the arms of Gabrielle in the east Ascendant Archangel alcove are switched to a forty-five-degree angle.
The {@creature Mummy||mummies} rise and attack if someone takes the mirrored shield, except the three with candles still lit around them who remain in state.

entries: This semicircular room is lined with rows upon rows of niches each with a single skull looking out into the centre of the room. A burning brazier rests in the middle that casts a soft glow highlighting the semi-precious stones or coins placed in the eye sockets of each of the skulls. Along the flat wall of the chamber are several rows of shelves that lie between two stone-carved archways that frame a portion of stone wall with nothing on it. The shelves are lined with small statues of various animals including a brass toad, a copper cat, a silver bird, an ivory ox, a granit bear, a gold horse, and an iron eagle.

The brazier within this chamber has an inscription carved into the stone around its base that reads "The bodies of our first Flamekeepers rest here under the watchful gaze of the dead. Ere a living soul should seek their guiding light, know that one who sees with clear eyes may open the way. Take up their shining truth with silver wings."

items: There is one skull that has no gems placed in its eyes. A small switch within the left eye socket causes the wall of the right archway to slide open.
A switch on the bottom of the silver bird statue causes the left archway to open.
Within each open alcove is a stone slab with a gloriously decorated body adorned with holy symbols and burning candles. Each clutches a shimmering mirror shield.
The aperture door in this chamber can be opened using a single shield and bouncing the light from the east Ascendant Archangel alcove at the east intersection.

entries.name: [5] Pool of the Mourning Angel
entries: This circular room has a domed roof painted with frescoes of knights carrying holy flames upon their hands and marching in a spiraling formation towards a central glowing light. A large marble font of water rests within the centre of this room with a tragic looking statue perched on the far end. Water flows from the statue's eyes, down its face, falling gently into the pool below.

This statue depicts an angelic man looking up to the heavens with a look of sorrowful anguish upon his crying face. His hands rest an inch above the water, fingers curled up as if he begs "why!" to the heavens. Along the base of the fountain are four evenly spaced iron handles.

items: A mirror shield can be placed upon the statue's hands, which can be rotated by grabbing the iron handles under the water. The light can then be reflected into the Scriptorium.

entries: The scriptorium is a large square room lined with wooden shelves from floor to ceiling. The shelves are overflowing with assorted texts, papers, scrolls, and documents all loosely organized by date. In the middle of the room are four large wooden tables flanked by rows of wooden stools. Several old tomes and scrolls lay upon the tables along with inkwells and quills. Ink stains the tables and one of the inkwells has toppled over causing the ink to spill to the floor and run through the cracks within the stone.

items: The documents all appear to be writings of holy texts, copies of famous literary works and historical stories of importance to the Sacred Flame.
Amongst the shelves are {@dice 2d6} rare {@item Spell Scroll||spell scrolls} from the cleric spell list, including a {@i scroll} of {@spell raise dead}.
Floating within the room is a {@creature wraith} and 2 ({@dice 1d4}) {@creature Warp Witch|DoDk|warp witches}.
Opening the Vault of Ignacious requires all six mirror shields to direct both heavenly beams into the statue. Three are placed on each side.

entries: Two long alcoves meet a small passage at the intersection of this L-shaped chamber. At the ends are large stone statues of armoured guardians each holding a kite shield before them. A large stone plaque is polished to a mirror sheen between them, opposing a narrow passage that ends in a bas-relief carving of two dragons rampant, each with an aperture lens in their mouth.

items: Opening the vault requires bouncing light from the east intersection, then bouncing the light {@i upwards} at the bottom of the shaft, then bouncing it east again at the top of the shaft. Since the shield would need to be positioned in midair, it's up to the characters to come up with a clever way to do this - but they'll need three mirror shields however they do it.
{@b {@i Lineage Records}.} This family tree with written descriptions of each person, marriage agreements, dowries, and adoption decrees is magically preserved and bears royal seals.
{@b {@i The Royal Will}.} What it says is up to you, but it could describe Ulrich IV's intentions if he were to die without a known heir.

{@b {@i Blood Phylacteries}.} This minor magical item is a glass vial that keeps the blood stored within preserved indefinitely. Once sealed, the stopper holds celestial runes naming the person whose blood is contained within, and can only be opened by the use of {@item universal solvent}. If a creature who is a direct blood relative holds the vial, the vial glows and runes appear within describing the nature of their relation (parent and child, siblings, cousins, ect.).
Vials of blood taken from Ulrich IV and his last six predecessors are kept here.

entries: Blessed is the lair of Ignacius! A wonderful gift for an impressive warrior.

This circular vaulted chamber is ribbed with strange bronze pipes and niches filled with candles. Hovering in place above a central dias in a column of flame is a glimmering silver blade. The chamber is otherwise unadorned, but filled with nearly blinding light and sweltering heat from the crackling flames.

items: This sword is {@item Ignacious, the Sword of Burning Truth|DoDk}. Whoever grips this blade is judged by the sword, which only accepts a righteous wielder.

entries: Those who take up the blade and are unworthy: "Thou art rough in spirit and brittle in soul, knave. Though perhaps if you prove to me your might, I shall take your coal-heart and iron limbs and temper them into a righteous instrument of blazing steel!"

items: The column of flame then collapses into a burning {@creature deva} wielding the blade, who challenges the characters to battle. Ignacious will allow itself to be wielded by any who defeat the deva, believing it can turn them to the cause of righteousness.

entries: A marble colonnade forms a narrow aisle around this circular chamber, each pillar set with a lighted torch. Murals upon the walls depict the deeds and battles of a valiant paladin, and a life-sized statue of the man stands upon a circular podium in the centre of the room.

He is clad in plate armour and wears a resplendent helm; a shield upon his pack, sword strapped to his belt, a sceptre at his side, and a phylactery around his neck. His outstretched arms extend fully to his sides, and his palms face outwards. Cavities in the statue at the right thigh, jaw, and within several knuckles hold the few remaining bones of Saint Vitruvio, each etched with delicate prayers. Glass spheres rest in the statue's eye sockets, and within the palms of the statue's hands are stigmata-like holes, each filled with a small lens. Hundreds of lit candles are set around the statue and about the room, and a mirrored shield is fixed on the wall to the south.

items: Accessing Saint Vitruvio's Tomb requires using two mirror shields to bounce light at the intersections, but can be done from either the east or west side.
Upon the wall is a golden shield. Behind the shield is a large circular aperture filled with glass. Surrounding it is a moulding depicting Saint Vitruvio riding upon Argonath.

Vitruvio's statue can be rotated, but also lowered and raised by pushing on it as an action. It can be moved into a position such that its palms are in line with the apertures on the doors, and its eyes are in line with the mirrored shield on the south wall.

If the heavenly beams of light from both Ascendant Archangel alcoves are reflected into the lenses on both of the statue's hands at the same time, a single thick beam shoots from the statue's eyes. The resulting beam strikes the aperture on the south wall, which then rumbles open revealing a wide spiral staircase leading to Argonath's Rest. Accomplishing this requires four mirror shields, one positioned at each intersection.

entries: The spiral staircase descends down a wide stone chimney into the earth, and eventually opens into a great natural cavern. Suffocating sulphurous-smelling vapours saturate the chamber. Resting in a pool of bubbling oil are the ancient remains of a colossal dragon. The great golden plates of its armoured scales still cling to its hulking skeletal remains, though the rest of its flesh has long since decomposed.

items: A {@spell forbiddance} spell wards this chamber; creatures can't teleport into the area.
An inscription reads: {@i "This was my brother in battle, Argonath. Let none disturb his deserved rest unless great darkness engulfs Drakkenheim at the end of days."}
Carrying an open flame in this chamber is a {@i very} bad idea.

These are the bones of Argonath, an {@creature ancient gold dragon}. The dragon can be restored to life by casting {@spell resurrection} using a spell slot and providing the {@i Diamond of Mount Kadath} or the {@i pristine delerium geode} as a material component. Thereafter, the dragon slumbers here unless commanded by one who wields all the relics of Saint Vitruvio.
The chimney by the staircase meets the cathedral floor above. If Argonath is resurrected, he exits this chamber by flying up the chimney and bursting through the floor.

entries.name: Developments
entries: Slaying the Lord of the Feast and conquering the cathedral provokes an immediate response from all the factions.

entries.name: Council at the Cathedral
entries: Shortly after the cathedral is retaken, the factions make overtures under the banner of armistice to hold a meeting there. Each faction leader (and their lieutenants) is present.

items: Eldrick Runeweaver sends his {@spell simulacrum}, his {@creature homunculus}, and River. They bring a {@item potion of invisibility} and a {@item Spell Scroll||scroll} of {@spell dimension door}, and escape immediately if conflict breaks out.

The Queen of Thieves sends a decoy, controlled via {@spell dominate person}. This patsy is disguised both physically {@i and} using a {@spell seeming} spell, and the Queen of Thieves directly controls this unfortunate captive and makes them behave as if they were actually her in person. She coordinates with her spies and assassins to launch an assassination strike against a vulnerable faction leader or the player characters. Blackjack Mel does not attend, however.
Elias Drexel, Theodore Marshal, and Lucretia Mathias arrive with a large contingent of their own faction troops nearby, ready to storm the cathedral if violence breaks out.

entries: All the faction leaders are keenly aware that violence could break out at any moment, but in fact, none of them are actually willing to {@i start} a fight here. During the discussion, faction leaders should bring up the following key questions:

items: What are the true motives of the player characters? Whose side are they on, really?
Which faction should control the cathedral?
What will be done about the royal documents?
Who will hold any {@i Seals of Drakkenheim} discovered so far? Who should rule Drakkenheim?
How should delerium be used?

entries: During this meeting, the roleplaying traits of the factions, their goals, and the faction leaders should be fully presented. Draw bright lines in the conflict, and don't be afraid to put the characters on the spot: each faction leader should address each player character directly at least once with a difficult question of some kind.

entries.name: Brutal Betrayal (Optional)
entries: If the player characters have greatly antagonized one of the factions before this meeting, that faction either secretly mobilizes several elite strike teams on standby or plants powerful explosives under the cathedral prior to the meeting. They also orchestrate an escape plan for their leader (which in the case of the Academy or the Queen of Thieves isn't needed since they are only present by proxy). During the meeting, the leader demands to be given either all of the Seals of Drakkenheim, the Relics of Saint Vitruvio, control of the cathedral, or any other insane ultimatum appropriate for the faction. If their demands aren't met, their forces attack or they detonate the explosives, which create a massive explosion akin to a {@spell meteor swarm} that fills the cathedral and collapses the roof and dome.

entries.name: Reigniting the Brazier
entries: Lucretia Mathias and Ophelia Reed both offer to reignite the {@i Brazier of the Sacred Flame} and reconsecrate the cathedral. This requires some ashes or bone fragments from a saint: either those of Saint Vitruvio himself or the gold dragon, Argonath, which can be recovered from the cathedral catacombs. If re-lit, the cathedral brazier fills the area with effects similar to {@spell hallow} and {@spell forbiddance}, and becomes a sanctuary in the city against the Haze where characters may rest normally.
If the cathedral was bombed, the brazier is destroyed and can't be reignited.

entries.name: Aftermath
entries: The cathedral remains hotly contested ground: the Followers of the Falling Fire and the Silver Order will try to take it from each other after these meetings regardless of how the negotiations turned out. If the Hooded Lanterns or the Queen of Thieves aren't able to gain the information in the House von Kessel vault, they'll launch counterstrikes as well to obtain them.

Any faction who holds onto the cathedral can establish a shaky safe haven there, but doing so stretches the faction's forces thin. Nevertheless, the player characters can use it as a base of operations. Ultimately, holding the cathedral for more than 14 ({@dice 4d6}) weeks proves untenable due to constant attrition, unless the player characters take action to drive out enemy factions and complete their allies' major objectives. By taking the cathedral the player characters have a major opportunity, but they must take advantage of it before it's too late.

entries.name: Slaughterstone Square
entries: Slaughterstone Square is an important crossroads in Drakkenheim - the intersecting streets here lead north to Castle Drakken, east to King's Gate, south to a bridge crossing the Drann River, and west to Market Square Plaza. Centuries ago the square was the core of the Old Town, home to the main marketplace and simply known as Flagstone Square. As the city grew it became a civic centre and eventually, a place for public executions. Its present moniker has never been more appropriate. The {@creature Executioner|DoDk} still occupies the plaza: a hulking clockwork knight designed to mete out death sentences. Contaminated by the Haze, the beserk machine now ferociously eviscerates any who dare pass through Slaughterstone Square.

entries.name: Overview
entries: Slaughterstone Square lies above the cistern, so we recommend you read this section first if your characters are seeking that location.

entries.name: Adventure Hooks
entries: Rumour claims a vast collection of treasure and magic items may be found here, left behind by the Executioner's countless victims. Many adventurers make the fatal last mistake of approaching Slaughterstone Square for this reason alone. However, your characters may simply happen upon this forsaken place by accident or on a foolish lark. Alternatively, some bold characters may be travelling through the square to reach the cistern, or possibly arrived via the smuggler's passage connected to the Black Ivory Inn.

entries.name: A Deadly Threat
entries: No matter why they came here, your characters should probably run. The Executioner is not a foe to be defeated, but rather an obstacle to be avoided (or perhaps an asset to use should the opportunity emerge to lure an unsuspecting foe here!). It is a reminder of the callous and uncontrollable dangers present in Drakkenheim. Embrace clever solutions your characters invent to escape or bypass this threat, but should your players engage the Executioner directly in combat, {@i do not pull any punches}. They have made an incredibly foolish mistake by confronting a well-telegraphed deathtrap, and should be served their just desserts!
When planning a trip to Slaughterstone Square, always remember: you dont have to outrun the Executioner, just your slowest party member...

Slaughterstone Square is a large octagonal plaza paved with broad flagstones with a squat, bowl-shaped granite fountain thirty feet wide and five feet tall at its centre. The tightly-packed surrounding townhouses rise up three storeys to high-steepled rooftops with wrought-iron cresting. Many feature narrow balconies and tall dour-looking windows on their front facades overlooking the square.
The building composition resembles stern faces held in silent judgement, as if all who look upon them are found wanting. Pools of coagulated blood stain the streets around several mangled corpses.

items: The {@creature Executioner|DoDk} stands utterly motionless beside the fountain, blood dripping from its axe.

It jolts to life and immediately charges any creature who attacks, casts a spell, or approaches within one hundred twenty feet of it. It attacks indiscriminately, and only pursues creatures beyond the square if it continues to be attacked.

The Executioner has formed a bizarre habit for gathering the bodies of its slain victims and hurling their remains into the fountain. Blood and body parts slosh around the fountain, and then are deposited into the cistern.

The fountain collects rainwater in a flowing spiral that drains into a five-foot diameter hole at the centre. The hole leads directly into the cistern below, where the water fills up the reservoir. There was once a wrought-iron grate covering the hole, but only a few protruding pieces of sharp iron are left there now.

Amongst the few corpses the Executioner hasn't yet dropped into the square may be found damaged adventuring equipment and weapons. If you wish, {@dice 1d6} uncommon {@i potions} and an uncommon magic item of your choice may be found here.
A heavy sewer cover beside the fountain can be lifted from this side with an action, proper leverage and a DC 20 Strength check. It opens to a stairway into the {@area Old Town Cistern|418|x}.

entries: The largest building in Slaughterstone Square is a somber and formal-looking manor house three storeys tall that takes up the entire block. Pointed windows with broken glass line each floor. Broad stone steps lead up to the double doors entrance, above which hang banners bearing the crest of the city itself.

items: This building served as both a courthouse and offices for the civilian functionaries such as the Lord Mayor and the city council. Many public records are housed in the archives here, so characters on a personal quest looking for information about people who lived in Drakkenheim could find such documentation here.

data.name: Chapter 8: Faction Strongholds
entries: During their adventures in Drakkenheim, characters may explore these five mighty faction strongholds in a variety of ways. Early in the campaign, they may interact on friendly terms with faction members at these locations, but once characters reach 9th level or higher they might consider hostile missions into enemy faction strongholds.

entries.name: Interaction
entries: Most commonly, player characters can visit a faction stronghold to meet with faction members and speak with the faction leader. Characters who are cooperatively working with a friendly faction may be invited to use the stronghold as a base of operations.

entries.name: Infiltration
entries: Characters might also attempt sneaking into a faction stronghold for a specific purpose, such as rescuing a prisoner, sabotaging resources or defenses, spying on the faction, stealing an important item, or even assassinating the faction leader. Every faction expects this to happen and has taken reasonable and intelligent precautions that should provide exciting challenges for stealthy characters. Factions that acquire key items in the campaign, such as the {@i Relics of Saint Vitruvio} or the {@i Seals of Drakkenheim} store them in secure locations usually guarded personally by the faction leader, set up extra patrols, and may ask faction spellcasters to use protective spells such as {@spell glyph of warding} to keep the items safe.

entries.name: Assault
entries: At some point in the campaign, the player characters may lead an invasion on an enemy stronghold in an all-out attack to drive an enemy faction out of Drakkenheim. The stakes should be appropriately high for such an exciting and decisive moment; a stronghold assault is a win-or-die play. You should give the players the opportunity to take the lead in coming up with a battle plan with their allies, and put the full resources (and tricks) of each faction front-and-centre.

However, given the troops involved, most factions simply cannot hide when they muster forces for an all-out attack on another faction stronghold unless specific and extensive action is taken to conceal it.
